text: I'm here on the beach on the eastern end
of Grand Isle Louisiana behind me you
see the detritus of the cleanup effort
oil spill booms absorbent pads all of
them overwhelmed by oil that came ashore
here within the last 24 hours with the
first act of the disaster still going on
a mile underwater out to sea with the
oil continuing to gush from the grope
and well the second act is going to be
cleaning up the products of the cleanup
all the material that has been used and
now bagged and taken away to landfills
all over the Gulf Coast the question is
what is in those bags how it should be
treated and what kind of landfill it
